title: Displaying Multiple Lines
simplifierConcept:
You've learned that Console.WriteLine displays text. But what if you want to display LOTS of information? You have two options:

1. Use multiple Console.WriteLine statements (you've been doing this!)
2. Use special characters like \n (newline) to create line breaks inside one statement

Think of \n as pressing the 'Enter' key on your keyboard. It tells the computer: "Start a new line here!"

syntaxBreakdown.explanation: The backslash-n creates a newline (line break). It's called an 'escape sequence' – special characters that do something instead of displaying.
Both methods work! Multiple WriteLine is clearer for beginners. Using \n is more compact but harder to read at first.

challenge.instructions:
Create a mini-biography using Console.WriteLine! Display:
• A title line: 'About Me'
• Your name
• Your age
• Your favorite hobby

Try using \n to create blank lines between sections for better readability!
challenge.hint: Remember: \n creates a blank line. Try Console.WriteLine("About Me\n"); to add space after the title!
commonStickingPoints: Writing /n instead of \n – it must be a BACKSLASH (\), not a forward slash (/)!
Forgetting quotes around text with \n – the entire string needs quotes: "Line1\nLine2"
Not seeing the newline work – make sure you're using Console.WriteLine, not Console.Write
